results.title: Local 100
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, James Beveridge and Bernard Devlin
results.brief_description: The story of how Local 100, an affiliate of a national union, was formed. The sudden dismissal of an employee makes the others realise their lack of job security, and discussion of this problem leads to the suggestion that they organise a trade union. The film relates the steps that followed - the approach to the national union, the assistance given by an organiser from union headquarters, and the signing up of the workers which resulted in Local 100 being declared the legal bargaining authority. We see, too, how collective bargaining was carried on to obtain a contract providing job security and improved conditions. The democratic procedure followed throughout proves the contention that free trade unionism is one of the strongest pillars of democracy.

results.title: Loads on structures
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Robert Heller discusses static and dynamic loads. He describes the deformations and stresses that they are produced by dynamic oscillation and presents news footage which shows the disastrous effects of loads on structures. Includes scenes of the collapse of the Tacoma Narrows bridge;”Years 7-12”

results.title: Loading the Dice(TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Can You Avoid Cancer?”.
This series aims to promote a better understanding of what cancer is and to develop a more hopeful and less emotional attitude to the disease. This program answers common questions and looks at the reasons why epidemiology could hold the clues to possible prevention.

results.title: Loaded
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Helen Bowden and Susan MacKinnon
results.brief_description: There are estimated to be over four million guns in Australia - one for every fourth person. This documentary introduces a group of men who share a passion for guns. They revere their high powered rifles, their antique pistols and their customised hand guns. The guns are as different as their owners but these men have a common belief in their right to own guns.

results.title: Lo-Arna 1981
results.creator_credit: Generation Films, Channel 0\28, Bob Weis and Geoffrey Nottage
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Women of the sun (A)”.
Part Four of the “Women of the Sun” series which presents events that occurred to four different aboriginal women, at different periods in time. This episode is set in 1981 and examines the inner turmoil and insecurity of an 18 year old girl when her adoptive parents tell her she is not of French Polynesian descent, but is the daughter of an Aboriginal woman.

results.title: Lloyds of London
results.creator_credit: World Wide and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: In a television interview lloyd’s chairman, Sir Matthew Drysdale answers various questions concerning the historical origins, development and present day functions of Lloyds of London. The interviewer is Robert McKenzie and to illustrate the discussion, scenes of activities, past and present, are included.

results.title: Lizzies of the field
results.creator_credit: Pathe Melody Comedies, Mack Sennett and Del Lord
results.brief_description: Two rival mechanics from competing garages, the Red Dog Garage and the Black Cat Garage, vie for the attention of the garage owner’s daughter. Their competition leads to them representing their respective garages in a 250 mile road race. Hijinks ensue as the villainous mechanic attempts to thwart the heroic mechanic. Features a spectacular multi-car pile up, some great stunts and lots of laughs. Cast includes Billy Bevan, Sidney Smith, Jack Lloyd, Barbara Pierce, John J. Richardson, Andy Clyde.

results.title: Lizzie's library: Possums don't wear boots
results.creator_credit: Henderson Bowman Productions, ABC-TV (Australia), Film Queensland, Australian Film Commission, Phillip Bowman and Tim Adlide
results.brief_description: Lizzie’s Library is a delightful and informative series for young children set in the little Australian riverside town of Long Flat. Lizzie the librarian is back in this second video with her loveable dog BJ, her Murri co-worker Munro and her mobile library Booksy. Join Lizzie and her friends in nine more lively adventures. Narration and voice characterisation by Noni Hazelhurst.

results.title: Lizzie's library
results.creator_credit: Henderson Bowman Productions, ABC-TV (Australia), Film Queensland, Australian Film Commission, Phillip Bowman and Tim Adlide
results.brief_description: Lizzie, the Librarian, lives in the small Australian riverside town of Long Flat. Lizzie is always having adventures together with her loveable dog BJ, her Murri co-worker Munro and her Mobile Library Booksy. The moral of her many tales is that the answers to problems can often be found in a book! Narrated by Noni Hazlehurst, this puppet animation featuring nine stories will delight pre-schoolers.

results.title: Lizards of Oz; Wombats: bulldozers of the bush
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit, Klaus Toft and Richard Campbell
results.brief_description: Narrated by Richard Morecroft these two documentaries introduce and examine the lives of some of Australia’s unique wildlife. “Lizards of Oz” explores the desert world of these little known creatures and examines how so many different species are able to co-exist in this seemingly inhospitable environment. Dragons, devils, goannas, geckos, legless lizards and skinks abound in this fasinating look at some of our small neighbours. “Wombats: bulldozers of the bush” examines the myths and reality of wombat life both above and below ground. Found only in and under Australia the poor- eyesighted wombat is mostly nocturnal, however these survivors of an ancient marsupial family - one member of which was as big as a cow, continue to suffer at human hands, blamed for damaging fences and fouling pastures.
